We still have quota 1 and remain unmatched, but it is only Round 12 and we already committed to a formal reassessment after Round 13. Accepting E now could block a higher-priority student if they apply in R13. Student_E is only talking (not applying), so we should keep them engaged, request any info that would allow rapid acceptance at reassessment, and reiterate timeline without committing prematurely.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

I’m writing in Round 13 to formally apply again, ahead of your post–Round 13 reassessment.

Confirmation: School_C is my first choice, and if offered the remaining seat I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling.

For rapid turnaround, you can reach me at:
- Email: student.e@email.example
- Phone: (555) 010-0200
I can respond within the same round.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: School_C is my #1 true preference and the only unmatched school remaining. They committed to a formal reassessment after Round 13 and requested a brief confirmation plus contact details to move quickly if no higher-priority applicant applies. I should submit a fresh formal application now (Round 13) including the exact confirmation and rapid-response contact info to maximize the chance they fill the seat with me at reassessment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your Round 13 application and for providing the confirmation and rapid contact details.

Following our post–Round 13 reassessment, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. Please reply within this round to confirm acceptance and we will proceed with the enrollment steps.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list but is ranked 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). We have held the seat through Round 13 specifically to see whether any higher-priority candidates apply. In this round, only Student_E has applied to us; there is no competing higher-priority applicant in our inbox. Given the reassessment commitment after Round 13, the risk of remaining unmatched (and ending with an unfilled seat) now outweighs the option value of waiting further, especially since Student_E has repeatedly demonstrated credible commitment to enroll immediately. Accepting Student_E now secures a match with an acceptable (listed) candidate and fulfills our stated reassessment plan.
